revised_title: Lunar Influence on Barometrical Mean in London's Climate
tldr: Luke Howard investigates the correlation between the moon's declination and the mean annual height of the barometer in London's climate. He finds that the barometrical mean is depressed when the moon's declination is south of the equator and that there is a gradual depression as the moon moves from full north declination to crossing the equator. He also discovers a cycle of 18 years in the mean pressure of the atmosphere, which increases and decreases over time.
